trans-unit.source: Establishes a hard link between an existing file and a new file

target.mrk: Establishes a hard link between an existing file and a new file

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: The name of the new file.

seg-source.mrk: The name of the new file.

target.mrk: The name of the new file.

trans-unit.source: The name of the existing file.

seg-source.mrk: The name of the existing file.

target.mrk: The name of the existing file.

target.mrk: Return Value

seg-source.mrk: True.

target.mrk: True.

trans-unit.source: False, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information

seg-source.mrk: False, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: The _WinAPI_CreateHardLink() is only supported on the NTFS file system, and only for files, not directories.

seg-source.mrk: The _WinAPI_CreateHardLink() is only supported on the NTFS file system, and only for files, not directories.

target.mrk: The _WinAPI_CreateHardLink() is only supported on the NTFS file system, and only for files, not directories.

trans-unit.source: The security descriptor belongs to the file to which a hard link points. The link itself is only a directory entry, and does not have a security descriptor.

seg-source.mrk: The security descriptor belongs to the file to which a hard link points.
The link itself is only a directory entry, and does not have a security descriptor.

target.mrk: The security descriptor belongs to the file to which a hard link points.
The link itself is only a directory entry, and does not have a security descriptor.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, when you change the security descriptor of a hard link, you a change the security descriptor of the underlying file, and all hard links that point to the file allow the newly specified access.

seg-source.mrk: Therefore, when you change the security descriptor of a hard link, you a change the security descriptor of the underlying file, and all hard links that point to the file allow the newly specified access.

target.mrk: Therefore, when you change the security descriptor of a hard link, you a change the security descriptor of the underlying file, and all hard links that point to the file allow the newly specified access.

trans-unit.source: You cannot give a file different security descriptors on a per-hard-link basis.

seg-source.mrk: You cannot give a file different security descriptors on a per-hard-link basis.

target.mrk: You cannot give a file different security descriptors on a per-hard-link basis.

trans-unit.source: Use _WinAPI_DeleteFile() function to delete hard links. You can delete them in any order regardless of the order in which they are created.

seg-source.mrk: Use _WinAPI_DeleteFile() function to delete hard links.
You can delete them in any order regardless of the order in which they are created.

target.mrk: Use _WinAPI_DeleteFile() function to delete hard links.
You can delete them in any order regardless of the order in which they are created.
